intro: Ctenodon venezolanus, commonly known as the Venezuelan ctenodon, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically features hairy leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences with colorful flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
